column1: Do you have a persistent cough lasting more than 2 weeks?
column2: Are you coughing up blood or blood-stained sputum?
column3: Do you experience night sweats regularly?
column4: Do you have a prolonged fever or fatigue?
column5: Have you been in close contact with a person who has TB?
column6: Have you previously been treated for TB?
column7: Have you traveled or lived in a region with high TB prevalence?
column9: Are you undergoing immune-suppressive treatment (e.g. cancer therapy)?
column11: Do you have chronic illnesses such as diabetes?
column12: Do you have a cough with mucus or phlegm?
column13: Do you have a high fever, chills, or sweating?
column14: Are you experiencing shortness of breath?
column15: Do you feel unusually fatigued or weak?
column16: Have you recently had a respiratory infection (like flu or cold)?
column17: Do you have asthma or COPD?
column18: Do you smoke or have a smoking history?
column19: Do you have any chronic heart or lung diseases?
column20: Have you received pneumococcal or flu vaccinations?
column21: Do you experience hoarseness or wheezing?
column22: Do you have chest pain that worsens with deep breaths?
column23: Are you frequently exposed to secondhand smoke, asbestos, or radon?
column24: Do you have a family history of lung cancer?
column25: Have you been exposed to occupational hazards (e.g. mining, construction)?
column26: Have you previously had radiation therapy to the chest?
column27: Do you have any chronic lung diseases (e.g. COPD, TB scars)?
column29: Are you above 45 years of age?
